body_html:
@ezyang I extended conv_test.TestConvolution.test_1d_convolution_nchw test. For some reason it didn't cover CUDNN engine. After adding the engine without the fix it started to fail:

RuntimeError: [enforce fail at conv_op_cudnn.cc:768] status == CUDNN_STATUS_SUCCESS. 3 vs 0. , Error at: ../caffe2/operators/conv_op_cudnn.cc:768: CUDNN_STATUS_BAD_PARAMError from operator: 
input: "X" input: "w" input: "b" output: "Y" name: "" type: "Conv" arg { name: "strides" ints: 2 } arg { name: "kernels" ints: 1 } arg { name: "dilations" ints: 2 } arg { name: "pads" ints: 2 ints: 2 } arg { name: "order" s: "NCHW" } arg { name: "force_algo_fwd" i: 3 } arg { name: "force_algo_dgrad" i: 1 } arg { name: "force_algo_wgrad" i: 5 } device_option { device_type: 1 } engine: "CUDNN"

After applying the fix tests succeeded. Note about forced algos: test tries to retrieve workspace size for each one which makes cudnnGetConvolutionForwardWorkspaceSize fail for some combinations of test parameters. I have limited forced algos by [0 1].

P.S. I noticed trivial merge conflict popped up. Do you want me to take care of it?

P.S. I noticed trivial merge conflict popped up. Do you want me to take care of it?
body:
@ezyang I extended `conv_test.TestConvolution.test_1d_convolution_nchw` test. For some reason it didn't cover CUDNN engine. After adding the engine without the fix it started to fail:
```
RuntimeError: [enforce fail at conv_op_cudnn.cc:768] status == CUDNN_STATUS_SUCCESS. 3 vs 0. , Error at: ../caffe2/operators/conv_op_cudnn.cc:768: CUDNN_STATUS_BAD_PARAMError from operator: 
input: "X" input: "w" input: "b" output: "Y" name: "" type: "Conv" arg { name: "strides" ints: 2 } arg { name: "kernels" ints: 1 } arg { name: "dilations" ints: 2 } arg { name: "pads" ints: 2 ints: 2 } arg { name: "order" s: "NCHW" } arg { name: "force_algo_fwd" i: 3 } arg { name: "force_algo_dgrad" i: 1 } arg { name: "force_algo_wgrad" i: 5 } device_option { device_type: 1 } engine: "CUDNN"
```

After applying the fix tests succeeded. Note about forced algos: test tries to retrieve workspace size for each one which makes `cudnnGetConvolutionForwardWorkspaceSize` fail for some combinations of test parameters. I have limited forced algos by [0 1].

P.S. I noticed trivial merge conflict popped up. Do you want me to take care of it?
